meanings.definition: The material used to fill in the gaps or spaces in a structure.
meanings.sent1: The infills were made of strong concrete to support the building.
meanings.sent2: The construction worker added the infills to complete the wall.
meanings.sent3: The infills decided to have a party in the empty space between the walls.
meanings.sent4: The infills were like puzzle pieces, fitting perfectly into the structure.
meanings.sent5: The bright red infills stood out against the grey walls.

meanings.definition: The act of filling in the gaps or spaces in a structure.
meanings.sent1: Careful infills were necessary to ensure the stability of the structure.
meanings.sent2: The infills were done swiftly to finish the project on time.
meanings.sent3: The infills raced each other to see who could fill the gap first.
meanings.sent4: The infills flowed smoothly into place like a river filling a canyon.
meanings.sent5: The infills were like the missing pieces of a jigsaw puzzle, completing the picture.
